The Penn Resiliency Program ( PRP ) school-based group intervention teach cognitive behavioral social problem-solving skill young adolescent . This study examine effectiveness PRP preventing symptom depression anxiety among group young adolescent . Participants open label study randomly assign one three group : adolescent PRP , adolescent plus parent PRP , treatment control . In adolescent PRP , student teach cognitive behavioral problem solve skill school counselor teacher . Parents PRP teach model reinforce skill taught adolescent program . Participants adolescent program attend twelve 90-minute group session school hour . Participants parent program attend six 90-minute group session . Adolescent participant attend booster session twice per year 2 3 year initial treatment end . Parents attend one booster session per year follow-up phase . Adolescents ' depression anxiety symptom assess questionnaire baseline , post-treatment , 6-month interval 2 3 year follow intervention .
